experience.name: Omni Creator Products
notes: Led development of backend and web services supporting account management and player onboarding, using Kotlin, React, and Spring Boot.
Built internal tooling (e.g., desktop launcher, distribution pipeline) to support content release and testing workflows for game teams.
Contributed to game platform services for authentication, user and party management, and player communication (e.g., email verification, account notifications).
Built and maintained a Discord-based bot to support early social features and moderation workflows.

experience.name: Hulu/Disney Streaming
notes: Led front-end development for interactive ad experiences across Huluâ€™s device platforms, collaborating closely with design and product teams.
Integrated third-party analytics SDKs across multiple platforms, ensuring accurate telemetry for live video playback and user interactions.
Improved rendering and navigation performance in the live programming guide, reducing initial load times by 75% (~6 seconds).
Delivered playback feature enhancements including seek behavior and channel-flipping mechanics across supported platforms.
Championed developer education across the org, giving internal talks on HLS standards, pair/mob programming, and team-scale planning practices.

experience.name: iStreamPlanet
notes: Designed and implemented automated video source routing and monitoring services in Python, interfacing with live broadcast hardware and control APIs.
Led observability and telemetry efforts for a high-volume transcoding platform using StatsD, Kafka, and DataDog, collaborating with engineers across a C++ codebase.
Built real-time ad and program signaling components in C#, ingesting SCTE-35 broadcast data and generating outputs based on custom configurations.
Developed a scalable logging and diagnostics pipeline using AWS Kinesis, Lambda, and ElasticSearch to support rapid debugging in production.
Investigated and resolved high-priority defects in live environments under tight operational timelines.

experience.name: Ingeniux Inc.
notes: Developed document search framework on top of Lucene allowing search results to be fine-tuned on a per customer basis. Improved original design to increase speeds up to 66%.
Addressed performance issues with user importing resulting in processing times going from hours to minutes.

experience.name: Schweitzer Engineering Laboratory
notes: Designed user interface and worked with senior engineers to develop reporting interface for power station equipment.
